f6_assessments.q0:
Integrating a simple ADA donation option in websites would be a great way to increase the usage and value of the network, as well as helping people who do important work for the community to be rewarded for their efforts.

They have also included documentation and a tutorial in their project plan, which is very important for seeing actual adoption and usage of the widget. 

Therefore I see this proposal as highly beneficial for the Cardano community.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team provided enough information about themselves through LinkedIn and Github pages to conclude that they would be able to follow through and finish this project in the 3 months specified by the challenge setting. 

They are asking for the maximum funding from the challenge setting, and that should be sufficient for completing the project.

The breakdown of their plan could have been elaborated a little further.
f6_assessments.q2:
They have provided enough information for the community to assess the progress and completion of the project. The problem statement and solution is clearly defined, so it is easy to understand what they will create, and what a succesful implementation would look like.

To assess the wider impact of the proposal, they could have quantified the userbase success metrics a little more, and might leave the question if they need more funding later to increase the adoption of their widget through marketing and informing people about it.

f6_assessments.q0: The project will be a widget to accept payments and donations. Idea is to be easy to embed into websites. Proposal fits the challenge it's in. There are such tools out there already, but the more the better. Accepting payments is a prety basic necessity so I don't doubt the value this project will bring. Key metrics are right on the spot. Succinct but very accurate. Userbase and the adoption should always be the top priority, and in here, they are.  I don't see anything missing in this proposal, and it's plain to see the team is full of professionals.  As a developer, I don't have any concerns about the proposal. Overall a great idea and a great proposal to match. Good job!
f6_assessments.q1: There are enough links provided and I was able to verify the people working on this project and their skillset is enough to match the work that needs to be done. IMHO this brings credability to the project in the eyes of the voters. The team members are already known, which is a big advantage compared to a lot of other proposals whish have no teams assembled. The budget is clear and broken down into identifiable items. It's reasonable if not underpayed. As a developer myself I can guarantee the timetable to complete the work is reasonable. There's a staightforward yet a sensible plan for implementation that shows easy steps to follow along.   One thing I was missing is described possible challenges to market and spread the knowlege to your peers and some mention of competition would be nice as well.  Overall I believe the project is feasible and can be implemented by the team mentioned.
f6_assessments.q2: There's a discord channel to keep the community posted for all future development and growth news so I have no doubt about the auditability of this project. As I already mentioned the KPIs are on point because they deal with addoption of the project which is the most important metric IMO when it comes to software development. There's a clear roadmap with simple milestones with a sensible timeframe for implementation.  The problem is clearly stated and the proposed solution is succinct but clear on the end result.  I anyone interested will be able to follow along with the development of this project. Good luck to you!
